title: Victims withholding information after three shootings in a week, Tasmania Police says | ABC NEWS
description: Three men have been shot in the space of a week in Hobart's northern suburbs, with police believing two of the incidents are related.  Tasmania Police says victims and witnesses appear to be withholding important information, including the identity of the offenders. title: Gold and silver jump after US attacks Venezuela, oil down slightly | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: Crude oil prices fell in choppy trading as markets as investors digested the implications of the United States taking control of Venezuela's vast oil reserves. title: Rallies in Sydney after Maduro's capture allowed under new restrictions | ABC NEWS
description: Controversial anti-protest laws in NSW had their first major test with rallies in Sydney both condemning and celebrating the capture of Nicolás Maduro. title: Trump threatens second Venezuela attack, lists other countries US could strike | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has been taken to a New York prison following his removal from the presidential palace in Caracas by US special forces. 00:38 Donald Trump threatens a second strike on Venezuela if the country's interim President doesn't comply with US demands. 01:37 Protestors have marched outside the prison where the former President is being held, but his capture is being heralded by the Venezuelan diaspora in Florida. 02:08 Donald Trump has hinted at escalating his response in other countries, including Cuba, Colombia and Greenland. 02:35 Trump's rhetoric has other countries in Latin America on edge, with Colombia deploying its military on the border with neighbouring Venezuela. 03:40 The US operation in Venezuela was months in the planning, with Trump giving the go ahead that evening as this timeline of events shows. 05:15 The ABC's Global Affairs Editor Laura Tingle looks at the attack on Venezuela and threats to other countries in relation to the US National Security Strategy released in December, and how the US sees itself in world affairs. title: Early recall of parliament likely in response to Bondi attack | ABC NEWS
description: Federal parliament is expected to be recalled early to push through gun laws and hate speech reform in response to the Bondi terror attack. The opposition says a snap sitting should have been called sooner, but the government says the draft legislation still needs to be finalised. title: Who's the boss? Managing Venezuela's power vacuum | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Following the capture of Nicolas Maduro, his deputy Delcy Rodriguez has been sworn in as Venezuela's interim president. But all the while, U.S. President Donald Trump has insisted he will remain in charge. Professor Rebecca Jarman from the University of Leeds speaks to The World's Girish Sawlani about who will be pulling the power levers in the weeks and months to come. #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Who's next? Trump takes aim at Colombia, Cuba following Venezuela action | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The dramatic capture of Nicolas Maduro and his wife Cilia Flores in Caracas took many by surprise, sending shockwaves across the world - particularly in South and Central America. Now, Donald Trump appears to be taking aim at Colombia, Cuba and even Mexico. Brian Fonseca, director of the Jack D. title: Is it better to sleep naked or wear pyjamas? | ABC NEWS
description: Pending further research for the 'one leg in, one leg out' strategy.  ABC reporter Kellie Scott reports on how what you wear to bed can affect sleep quality. She interviews sleep expert Kathleen Maddison from the Centre for Sleep Science at the University of Western Australia. Kellie appears in pyjamas, using a bed and an eye mask as part of the set and costume. The video features a mixed-media graphic style. description: Donald Trump's justification for the US operation to capture Nicolas Maduro included claims Venezuela had "unilaterally seized and stole American oil, American assets and American platforms". title: As Gen Z moves into work how's it affecting the workplace? | ABC NEWS
description: Gen z employees are posting social media videos of themselves singing and dancing with their older co-workers, showcasing positive relationships between colleagues from different generations.   With the national retirement age rising to 67, generational diversity in Australian workplaces is increasing.   According to the Australian Bureau of Statistics, health care, social assistance, education, and training are some of the most age-diverse industries.  Reporting by Chelsea Malunga.
